page.title: 15FARMING IN NORTH YATE
page.content: Quite a lot of the area to the north of Yate is farmland.We talked to a local farmer about his farm.We asked him what he liked best about being a farmer,and he said the way of life, and his love of nature.The machinery he uses is reasonably modern,with tractors and silage cutters.The only animals he keeps are steers,and all his land is used for grazing.The animals also eat high quality silage. The size of the farm is 40 hectares. The present owner of the farm,Frank Pryor,bought the farm from a relation. The buildings he has on the farm are a straw barn,an implement shed,and there is also a covered cattle yard. He very rarely hires any extra labour.
